author: Ryan Morrison
title: Catalystwinners.com
description: It is currently not easy to find which projects have won on each Fund. That could eventually undermine the transparency of Catalyst.

assessments.note: I agree that finding the winners is not easy today, personal experience, and the community would benefit a lot from this. Although, it seems that a new website with this sole purpose is too much. It could go inside another one, for example, there is already the Master Landing Page initiative going on. Both ideas could be placed in the same website, in different sections. Also, this could be integrated with the accountability of each proposal, but it would need more investment.

Yes, featuring previously funded projects and supporting them to reach new heights is definitely going to be helpful. However, rather than building a yet another website, you should utilize your strengths and bring your value addition to other like-minded projects such as https://adapulse.io/ (although I like your URL better. If it was up to me I would keep that as the main site and point AdaPulse to CatalystWinners.com instead).

Same way you could offer to aggregate news to: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Project-Catalyst-Landing-Page/341718-48088

(Mind you, CardaNews doesn't seem to work on Brave Browser for some reason.)
I had the same problem myself. It would also make it easier for new teams, to get in touch with already established projects and build on them. Easy access and transparency are important facts.
This is a single use solution that results in a final product without extended benefits. The commentors had valid points which were not answered.

this doesn't really address the challenge although this idea is good and should be a part of ideascale anyway.
winners and 'progress reports' will allow visibility and help everyone understand where the community is leading us and how that aligns to our overall objectives. simple infographics would help too.
Proposal aims at tracking projects funded through Project Catalyst in order to educate the community and hold proposers accountable. It indirectly affects decision making by educating participants.

The idea is fascinating and a good starting point that has potential to ignite further community discussion. There is a need to have a platform that provides info on winning projects, tracking of ongoing projects, documentation, generals FAQs, Advisor support and training. A wider discussion and involvement of wider society inputs to create a much more usable system would be great.

Having a site to address related society issues can make system difficult to manage and refer to.

I would suggest the project should also consider to have APIs to connect with existing system to fetch the information and results using automation.

Having said that even if the given idea is deployed it would be beneficial to the community as it is currently difficult to get all this information specially for advisors who haven't worked in past fundings. This initiative can be a testing grounds for future robust and wider system.

Few other things that worries me are :
* Will this platform require funding during every funding cycle or is there a way to make this system self-sustaining?

In my opinion, automation and larger community involvement would be required to make such systems more sustainable and useful.

I would like to see plan for growth and involvement of wider community to build much more useful system.

The proposal, while promising and important for the future of Catalyst, doesn't address the challenge. The focus of the challenge is on improving decision making and this needs to be done before the proposals are funded, while the focus of the proposal is on monitoring the funded proposals and their audit. I recommend that the proposal be submitted in an appropriate challenge, as it brings important and necessary ideas to Catalyst.

Based on the proposer experience, it seems to be very feasible, since it does not required much technical knowledge and the proposer already has experience in sharing information. Budget seems reasonable, although cost with website hosting could be lowered, as mentioned in the comments section.

My honest recommendation:
Join an existing team and offer your skills. If Podcasts is your thing, handle the audio part. If you prefer to focus in creating landing pages for winning projects, stick to that.
CardaNews.com is a okay site. It is overloaded with large pictures on a pc but it looks really nice on a mobile device. I think the result would be fine.
The work itself should not take too long collecting previous winners, and is most likely available and compiled already. Without ability or design/plan to expand, this is a one time shot.
as it stands the proposal will work but needs more work to become a useful resource
Clear and concise plan and cost breakdown, sufficient experience in running web pages and podcast.

In its given form the proposal will certainly be deployed considering the experience of the proposer.

I would say there a strong plan required to grow on this idea to be more useful for the community.

Although the plan doesn't address the challenge, I believe the plan is reasonable, the proposal mentions the possibility of making podcasts with the funded proposals, is this included in the budget? I find it an interesting idea and could be incorporated into the proposal.

The proposer is already a participative member of the Cardano community, he is the host of the Cardano Podcast and this shows his commitment, but I recommend including more details about his professional experience and qualifications in the proposal,

KPIs are well defined, but some numbers would improve them. The roadmap should also be described and each milestone should be clearly defined. This could also include what else would be included in the proposed website besides listing and video interviews, like accountability/auditability of the proposals, for example.

I don't see a yet another website to be very helpful. That's why one star. Metrics are ok, that's why another. Perhaps add metrics regarding engaging with and sharing the content plus conversion (e.g. new recruits joining Project Catalyst or the wining teams, participation in possible crowdfunding etc).

No milestones are mentioned in the proposal but creating a website that solves the requirements might not be such a big deal. There were some comment regarding the proposal and the proposer did not make a single comment. I want to have this fact in one of the evaluation criterias and thefore I reduced this one a bit.

The feasibility of creating a website and making a list is easy with the requisite knowledge. The effectiveness of these funds providing long term gains is questionable without addressing the list of ideas and thoughts added by the comments, that were not addressed.
not sure how useful measuring number of visits will help at this stage.
It's a relatively simple proposal, well thought out and organised, it can be easily audited.
There is enough information to see that the given idea will be highly likely to be implemented successfully but the effectiveness of the idea will need more research, involvement and planning.
The proposal doesn't address the challenge, but the information described is sufficient to indicate its feasibility. I recommend submitting the proposal in an appropriate fund.

solution: A website showing the winning projects of each Fund and Campaign. Making Catalyst more transparent. This would encourage more participation.
experience: I've built CardaNews.com and I run the Cardano Podcast.
